articles.title: Malaysian Party Leader Meets WPK Delegation
articles.content:
Malaysian Party Leader Meets WPK Delegation
 Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- Datuk Seri Tengku Adnan Tengku Mansor, secretary general of the United Malays National Organization of Malaysia, on Nov. 26 met and had a talk with the delegation of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) led by Vice Department Director of its Central Committee Pak Kun Gwang. 
					 The delegation visited Malaysia to take part in the Congress of the United Malays National Organization of Malaysia. 
					
					 The secretary general expressed thanks to Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the WPK, for sending a delegation to the congress of his party. He said his party was pleased that everything goes well in the DPR of Korea under the leadership of the WPK. 
					
					 The WPK and the Korean people are channeling their efforts into economic construction and the improvement of the people's living standard, he said, adding: 
					
					 It is the consistent stand of the United Malays National Organization of Malaysia to favorably develop the relations with the WPK. 
					
					 A memorandum of understanding on cooperation and exchange between the two parties was signed.

articles.title: DPRK Goodwill Delegation Leaves for Vietnam
articles.content:
DPRK Goodwill Delegation Leaves for Vietnam
 Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- A DPRK goodwill delegation headed by So Ho Won, vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries who doubles as chairman of the DPRK-Vietnam Friendship Association, left here on Saturday to visit Vietnam.

articles.title: DPRK Ambassador to Ethiopia Appointed
articles.content:
DPRK Ambassador to Ethiopia Appointed
 Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- Kim Chol Ho was appointed as DPRK ambassador to Ethiopia, according to a decree of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly.

articles.title: More Rallies of Service Personnel, People Held
articles.content:
More Rallies of Service Personnel, People Held
 Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- Rallies of service personnel and people were held in Nampho and Rason cities on Saturday to support the statement of the National Defence Commission (NDC) of the DPRK and vow to foil the anti-DPRK "human rights" campaign kicked up by the U.S. and its followers.
					 Present there were officials of the local party, power and economic bodies and working people's organizations, service personnel of the Korean People's Army (KPA) and the Korean People's Internal Security Forces, working people, youth and students.
					
					 The statement of the NDC of the DPRK was read out at the rallies.
					
					 Representatives of the KPA service personnel, workers, agricultural workers, youth and students in their speeches said that the "human rights resolution" against the DPRK fabricated by the U.S. and other hostile forces is a shameless political document peppered with sheer sophism. 
					
					 This is nothing but a foolish attempt of those struck with horror in face of the heroic stamina of the DPRK dashing ahead like the wind towards a bright morrow, they noted.
					
					 It is ridiculous, indeed, for the U.S. to talk about the "human rights" issue as its true colors as a tundra of human rights are brought to light by the unbroken occurrence of grisly incidents, they said, stressing: The army and people of the DPRK will never allow their genuine human rights to be insulted and its independence and sovereignty to be encroached upon but deal a merciless sledge-hammer at the U.S. imperialists and their followers.
					
					 Then followed demonstrations of the participants.

articles.title: Progress Made in Machine-building Industry of DPRK
articles.content:
Progress Made in Machine-building Industry of DPRK
 Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- Machine-building industrial workers of the DPRK are making a signal progress in the production of generating equipment.
					 By introducing rational processing methods and intensifying a mass technological innovation movement, the Taean Heavy Machine Complex and the Ryongsong Machine Complex boosted the production of equipment to be supplied to thermal and hydraulic power stations in across the country.
					
					 The Rakwon Machine Complex and other machine producers of the country overfulfilled their assignments for ordered equipment needed to increase the electricity output.

articles.title: Land Management Campaign Brisk in DPRK
articles.content:
Land Management Campaign Brisk in DPRK
 Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- Various works have been done in different parts of the DPRK to give a new appearance to the country in the autumn period of general mobilization for land management.
					 In Pyongyang, citizens smoothly carried out such scheduled projects as planting trees around the Fatherland Liberation War Martyrs Cemetery and other areas and paving roads of tens of thousands of square meters.
					
					 Those in North Hwanghae Province worked on the improvement of roads and rivers extending more than one hundred kilometers and the repair of at least 1, 400 dwelling houses.
					
					 North Hamgyong Province created 19,000 hectares of forest of economic value and built a fire-belt extending several hundreds of kilometers, while    North Phyongan Province made lawns of 1,000 square meters along roads.
					
					 Similar works were also done in other provinces of the country.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Blasts S. Korean Authorities' Unchangeable Ambition for Confrontation
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Blasts S. Korean Authorities' Unchangeable Ambition for Confrontation 
 Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet regime is getting evermore frantic with its moves for confrontation, pursuant to the U.S. anti-DPRK "human rights" racket. Witnessing this reality, the fellow countrymen keenly realize that its wild ambition for confrontation remains unchanged and it can never change.  Rodong Sinmun Saturday says this in an article. 
					 The successive south Korean conservative groups having not an iota of consciousness of independence have faithfully served the purpose of the U.S. hostile policy towards the DPRK, kowtowing it, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 They, obsessed with the illusion and idea of submitting to the U.S. that everything is OK when depending on it, have unhesitatingly sold out the dignity and interests of the nation.
					
					 The south Korean puppet regime has thrown the inter-Korean relations into the evil cycle of confrontation by prioritizing outside forces and cooperating with them. 
					
					 It remains unchanged in its bad habit of fostering distrust and antagonism between fellow countrymen in violation of the north-south agreements. 
					
					 The reckless acts of the present south Korean authorities are putting the preceding puppet ruling quarters into the shade. 
					
					 They are a group of traitors who stoop to any infamy to escalate the confrontation with the fellow countrymen in the north and they cannot live even a moment without hurting the fellow countrymen. 
					
					 It is by no means fortuitous that the puppet group has frantically kicked up its confrontation racket, challenging all the efforts of the DPRK to improve the north-south relations and achieve peace and prosperity common to the nation through dialogue and cooperation. This has become clearer at present.
					
					 Whoever truly hopes for the independent development and prosperity of the nation and reunification of the country should actively turn out in a patriotic struggle irrespective of ideology and ism to eliminate the group of traitors from the arena of history.

articles.title: Myth of "World's Only Superpower" Bound to Be Shattered: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Myth of "World's Only Superpower" Bound to Be Shattered: Rodong Sinmun
 Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- The U.S. war chariot pushed by its poor servants is inching close to the territory of the DPRK every hour, says Rodong Sinmun Saturday in an article.
					 But the DPRK remains unfazed. The increased frenzy on the part of the enemies is a clear proof of steady advance of the DPRK and its victory, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 The U.S. finds itself tight-cornered as the days go by.
					
					 In fact, the DPRK provided the U.S. with several opportunities to cool its head overheated by confrontation and hostile policy toward it and judge the gravity of the situation with reason. It was not long ago that the DPRK showed magnanimity to the U.S. high-ranking officials who visited it with a personal letter of the boss of the White House. Besides, it also showed humanitarian leniency to the U.S. criminals who were sentenced to heavy penalties for seriously breaching the DPRK law. The U.S., however, responded to them with hostile acts.
					
					 This goes to clearly prove that the hysteria of the U.S. to stand in confrontation with the DPRK to the last out of its inveterate repugnancy and bad blood towards the ideology and social system chosen by the Korean people has gone beyond the danger line.
					
					 The present situation proves once again the truth that it is necessary to settle accounts with the U.S. imperialists who regard the jungle law as the law governing their existence through physical counteraction, not by talking.
					
					 Should the U.S., obsessed with strength-all-powerful theory, recklessly use military force against the DPRK, the arrogant "myth of the world's only superpower" that it is allowed to hit others but is free from any punishment is bound to be shattered to smithereens. 
					
					 The army of the DPRK knows no mercy.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities' Moves to Enact "Law on Human Rights in the North" Denounced
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities' Moves to Enact "Law on Human Rights in the North" Denounced
 Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet forces recently cried out for bringing the "bill on human rights in the north" up for discussion at the Foreign Affairs and Unification Committee of the "National Assembly" to have it carried within this year. Accordingly, the "Saenuri Party" presented a package of five "bills on human rights in the north" to the NA on Nov. 21.
					 A commentary of Rodong Sinmun Saturday says the puppet forces' moves to enact the "law" is the worst politically-motivated provocation as it flatly denies the dignified socialist system in the DPRK and openly declares the confrontation of social systems.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 The "law" is peppered with fraud, conspiracy, plots and deception.
					
					 It is the unprecedented evil law against the DPRK and a document of political swindle aimed to hurt the fellow countrymen, justify the confrontational policy and push the north-south relations to the extreme phase in a bid to realize the ambition for achieving the unification of the social systems.
					
					 What should not be overlooked is that the puppet forces' moves to enact the "law" are timed to coincide with the U.S.-led international "human rights" racket against the DPRK.
					
					 Taking the adoption of the "human rights resolution" against the DPRK at the UN as a golden opportunity for ramming the "bill" through the NA, the south Korean puppet forces have made desperate efforts to achieve their purpose within this year by every possible means.
					
					 This clearly proves that the puppet forces' moves to enact the "law" is a product of the vicious scheme to isolate and stifle the DPRK in collusion with outsiders as it is a zealous pursuance of the "human rights" offensive against the DPRK.
					
					 The puppet forces will be held wholly accountable in case the north-south relations are pushed into the uncontrollable catastrophe.

articles.title: Arms Guarantees Justice, Peace and Human Rights: Minju Joson
articles.content:
Arms Guarantees Justice, Peace and Human Rights: Minju Joson
 Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- The conclusion drawn by the DPRK from the whole historic course of the DPRK-U.S. confrontation and present stern reality underscores the truth that the DPRK's arms guarantees justice, peace and human rights.
					 Minju Joson Saturday says this in a commentary.
					
					 The arena of the UN is threatened with the draconian logic that all countries should unconditionally meet the U.S. demand in defiance of international law and the UN Charter and, consequently, the inviolable political order of the UN is getting utterly confused and the UN turning into a theatre of highhanded and arbitrary practices and political fraud of a specified state, the commentary notes, and goes on:
					
					 This was clearly proved by the course of the adoption of the anti-DPRK "human rights resolution" at the UN.
					
					 Despite the DPRK's repeated warnings, the U.S. finally prodded riff-raffs who have neither elementary viewpoints nor principles into fabricating the "human rights resolution" against the DPRK, besmirching the UN arena.
					
					 What should not be overlooked is the fact that the frantic "human rights" racket kicked up at the UN is a product of the U.S. policy aimed to topple the socialist system of the DPRK which its army and people consider dearer than their own lives, and the latest evil version of it.
					
					 The U.S. has run the whole gamut of hostile policies towards the DPRK such as political isolation, economic blockade and military pressure. Finding all of them unworkable, the U.S. picked up the "human rights" card in a bid to invent a pretext for launching armed intervention.
					
					 The DPRK has a clearer road to follow now that its security and supreme interests are being encroached upon and even the UN is in no position to protect it. 
					
					 The U.S. should stop acting rashly, properly understanding the firm will of the army and people of the DPRK to defend its supreme interests at the risk of their lives.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Terms U.S. State of Sexual Maniacs
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Terms U.S. State of Sexual Maniacs
 Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- The Russian internet news Inosmi. Ru said that during the more than six decades of their presence in south Korea the U.S. forces have reduced one million women in south Korea to sexual slaves for them. 350 000 south Korean women fell victim to sexual slavery for the U.S. forces between 1945 and 1953 and more than 20 000 women in 1962. As a result, one million south Korean women provided sex to the U.S forces present in south Korea since 1945.
					 Commenting on this, Rodong Sinmun says the U.S imperialist aggressors have not treated south Korean women as human beings but regarded them as playthings and slaves who satisfy their carnal desire.
					
					 The hair-raising human rights abuses perpetrated by the U.S. forces since they landed in south Korea under the mask of "liberators" are lashing all the Koreans into great fury.
					
					 The above-said information brings into light the hypocrisy of the rhetoric let loose by the U.S. rulers to justify the U.S. forces' presence in south Korea. They claim that south Korea enjoys the present "growth" thanks to the close relationship with the U.S. The information brings into bolder relief the disgusting aspect lurking behind their high-sounding words.
					
					 The U.S. forces' human rights abuses in south Korea prove that the U.S. is, indeed, the world's worst pornographic state and U.S. forces overseas are hordes of robbers and sexual maniacs who ruthlessly violate the dignity of women in the countries they are stationed.
					
					 The U.S. has neither qualifications to talk about the human rights of the DPRK nor justification to style itself a "human rights judge".
					
					 The commentary urges the U.S. to mind its own business as it has perpetrated all sorts of human rights abuses.

articles.title: U.S. Should Be Brought to Human Rights Tribunal: DPRK People
articles.content:
U.S. Should Be Brought to Human Rights Tribunal: DPRK People
 Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- DPRK citizens are now strongly demanding that the United States be brought to international tribunal for its flagrant human rights violations.
					 Referring on the fact that the deadly Ebola virus was reported to be spread by the U.S., kingpin of human rights abusers in the world, Hong Sun Gwang, vice-president of the State Sanitary Inspection Board of the DPRK, told KCNA: 
					
					 Roberts, who was an aide to ex-U.S. President Reagan, disclosed in an article that the U.S. developed a progenitor of Ebola virus at bio-weapon institutes built in West African countries for the purpose of launching a biological warfare.
					
					 The news has stunned the world community. Russian scientists, a Liberian professor and an Egyptian newspaper criticized the U.S. government and military as chief culprits who conducted a bio-terrorism in African nations with Ebola virus.
					
					 Nevertheless, the U.S. acts a "human rights judge" in international arena, pulling up other countries over "human rights records".
					
					 The U.S. is the A-class criminal that should face a stern punishment by mankind for its unprecedented human rights violations.
					
					 Dr. Kim Yong Suk, a section chief of the Ministry of Higher Education, said:
					
					 Anti-racism demonstrations have lasted for more than 100 days in the U.S., with the case of shooting an innocent young black man to death by a white policeman as a starting point.
					
					 Even after a state of emergency was declared in Ferguson City, Missouri State on November 17, the demonstrations raged throughout the U.S., including New York and Los Angels, in protest against the decision not to indict the murderer.
					
					 However, the U.S. police again shot to death a 12-year-old black boy in Ohio State.
					
					 The facts clearly show that the U.S. is the worst tundra of human rights to be condemned by the world people.

articles.title: Arms Build-up of S. Korean Puppet Regime Censured
articles.content:
Arms Build-up of S. Korean Puppet Regime Censured
 Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- The People for Achieving Peace and Reunification of south Korea held the 152nd meeting for peace and disarmament near the building of the "National Assembly" in protest against the arms buildup moves of the puppet regime.
					 The speakers at the meeting accused the regime of shaping the 2015 military budget 6.1 percent bigger than the previous year's.
					
					 Terming its decision to spend a fabulous amount of money for introducing U.S.-made F-35s a typical waste in the budget, they called for cutting it down.
					
					 They also demanded the regime reduce the fund for improving U.S. military facilities, part of sharing expenses for the upkeep of the U.S. forces present in south Korea, as it has no basic conditions for meeting the budgetary requirements.
					
					 They urged the authorities to cut down the military budget and increase the budget for welfare.

articles.title: Formation of Nongovernmental Investigation Organization for Probing Truth about Sewol Disaster Declared in S. Korea
articles.content:
Formation of Nongovernmental Investigation Organization for Probing Truth about Sewol Disaster Declared in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- The Measure Committee of the Families of Victims, Missing Persons and Survivors of the Ferry Sewol Sinking Accident of south Korea on Nov. 26 said it would form a nongovernmental investigation organization for probing the truth about the ferry Sewol disaster, according to MBC of south Korea.
					 It said it would take part in salvaging and disposing of the ferry Sewol.

articles.title: Strike Staged in S. Korea in Demand of Wage Hike
articles.content:
Strike Staged in S. Korea in Demand of Wage Hike 
 Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- The Trade Union of the Hyundai Heavy Industry Co. Ltd. staged a strike in demand of wage hike on Nov. 27, according to the south Korean KBS.
					 The organization recalled that it has conducted negotiations on over 50 occasions with the company side but, the demand for wage hike has not been met.
					
					 It lodged strong protest with the company side which trampled down the workers' right to existence under the pretext of "worsening difficulties of management".

articles.title: Japanese Government Urged to Apologize for Sexual Slavery
articles.content:
Japanese Government Urged to Apologize for Sexual Slavery
 Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- A candlelight rally took place in Paris to denounce the Japanese imperialists for their sexual slavery, according to KBS of south Korea on Nov. 27.
					 South Korean woman Kil Won Ok who had been forced into sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army in the past condemned the Japanese imperialists for ruthlessly trampling down the rights of women of Korea and other Asian countries and committing unheard-of crimes.
					
					 Demanding Japan admit its past sexual slavery, she called upon the international community to pool efforts in the campaign to wrest an apology from the Japanese government.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Work Published in Bulgaria
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Work Published in Bulgaria
 Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un's work "Let Us Brilliantly Accomplish the Revolutionary Cause of Juche, Holding Kim Jong Il in High Esteem as the Eternal General Secretary of Our Party" was brought out in booklet by a Bulgarian publishing house.
					 The work published on April 6, Juche 101 (2012) says that it is a principled requirement for victoriously advancing the Korean revolutionary cause to hold Kim Jong Il in high esteem as the eternal general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					
					 It indicates tasks to be fulfilled to steadily develop the WPK into the glorious party of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					 A book-releasing ceremony took place in Sofia on Nov. 24.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Remembered in Various Countries
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Remembered in Various Countries
 Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- Meetings took place in Norway, Slovakia and Benin from Nov. 6 to 17 on the occasion of the third anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 Dag Norum, chairman of the Ostfold County Committee of the Communist Party of Norway, said that Kim Jong Il was the great thinker and theoretician and great master of leadership who developed the Workers' Party of Korea into an invincible party and the Korean People's Army into a matchless revolutionary army.
					
					 Ivan Draxler, chairman of the Slovakia-Korea Friendship Association, praised Kim Jong Il for performing the Songun leadership exploits.
					
					 The DPRK is fully displaying the vitality of the Songun politics in all domains including economy, defence, science, culture, education and public health under the guidance of Marshal Kim Jong Un, he noted, adding:
					
					 The Korean people will invariably advance along the road of independence, Songun and socialism as they are led by Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Hessou Kohovi, chairman of the Benin-Korea Amicable Association "Long Live Kim Jong Il, Supreme Leader" who doubles as chairman of the Benin National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea, said that Kim Jong Il's exploits would shine forever along with the prosperity of the DPRK.
					
					 Messages to Kim Jong Un were adopted at the meetings held in Norway and Benin.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Exploits Lauded by Personages of DR Congo, Indonesia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Exploits Lauded by Personages of DR Congo, Indonesia
 Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- Political figures of DR Congo and Indonesia issued statements on Nov. 17 and 21 on the occasion of the third anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 Otete Gaston Mboyo, deputy general secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of DR Congo who doubles as chairman of the DR Congo-Korea Friendship and Solidarity Association, said:
					
					 Kim Jong Il provided a powerful ideological and theoretical weapon to progressive humankind by developing and enriching the Juche idea and consolidated the single-minded unity of the Korean society centered on the leader in every way by proclaiming the programme for modeling the whole society on Kimilsungism.
					
					 He protected the peace and security of the Korean Peninsula by smashing the imperialists' invasion and high-handed and arbitrary practices with his Songun politics and unrolled a far-reaching plan for building a thriving socialist nation.
					
					 Andreas Hugo Pareira, chairman of the Central Directive Council of the Indonesian Democratic Party of Struggle, said:
					
					 Kim Jong Il was not only the great leader of the Workers' Party of Korea and the Korean people but also a close friend of the Indonesian people and a world political  elder.
					
					 Three years have passed since he passed away, but the exploits her performed for the Korean revolution and the global cause of independence are always remembered by the WPK and the Korean people and progressive mankind.
					
					 He was the great leader who turned the DPRK into a political and military power by wisely leading the party, state and army with the Juche idea and unique Songun politics.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Exploits Praised Abroad
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Exploits Praised Abroad
 Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- Seminars on exploits of leader Kim Jong Il were held in Romania, Uganda and Ethiopia on Nov. 22 and 24.
					 Constantin Rotaru, chairman of the Party for Socialist Choice of Romania, said the whole life of Kim Jong Il dedicated to the destiny of the country and nation and happiness of the people would always be remembered by the Korean people.
					
					 Kirunda Kivejinja, senior adviser to the Ugandan president, referred to the fact that the greatest exploit of Kim Jong Il was that he enriched the Juche idea founded by President Kim Il Sung, giving strong impetus to the global cause of independence.
					
					 Henri Masico, department director of the Presidency of Uganda, noted Kim Jong Il passed away but his idea and exploits would last forever. 
					
					 The chief of a branch of the Ethiopian National Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism, praised Kim Jong Il for providing the ever-victorious treasured sword for the human cause of independence by developing in depth the Juche idea and the Songun idea.

articles.title: Songun Politics Praised by Bulgarian Organization
articles.content:
Songun Politics Praised by Bulgarian Organization
 Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- The Bulgaria-Korea Friendship Association issued a bulletin introducing the Songun politics in the DPRK on Nov. 21. 
					 The bulletin carried several articles illustrated with a portrait of smiling leader Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 The article titled "Songun politics decisive of people's destiny" said: 
					
					 Kim Jong Il considered the bolstering of the military capability as the most important national affair, directed primary efforts to it and built the People's Army into a main force of the revolution.
					
					 The People's Army which has grown to be a matchless army under his wise leadership has firmly protected the security of the country from the U.S. imperialists and their followers' ceaseless military provocations and played a leading role in the socialist economic construction, too.
					
					 The Songun politics has honorably protected the sovereignty of the DPRK, the socialist cause and the destiny of people from the imperialist allied forces' offensive.
					
					 Another article titled "Comrade Kim Jong Il's exploits performed for national reunification" said he provided the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration and the October 4 declaration through his energetic activities.
					
					 The bulletin also conveyed the accounts of the revolutionary activities of Kim Jong Un, supreme commander of the Korean People's Army.

articles.title: German Organization Raps S. Korean Authorities' Provocations against DPRK
articles.content:
German Organization Raps S. Korean Authorities' Provocations against DPRK
 Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- The German Branch of the Korean Friendship Association made public a statement on Nov. 16 in denunciation of the south Korean authorities' provocations to the DPRK.
					 The statement accused the south Korean authorities of aborting the north-south high-level contact through their provocations.
					
					 They staged the largest-ever Hoguk-14 targeted against the DPRK and conducted the leaflet scattering operations against it.
					
					 Battleships of the south Korean puppet army are frequently intruding into territorial waters of the DPRK under the pretext of defending the illegal "northern limit line".
					
					 The puppet army recklessly fired bullets and shells at service personnel of the Korean People's Army on routine patrol duty in the area north of the Military Demarcation Line.
					
					 This being a hard reality, the south Korean authorities are claiming that the DPRK is putting up "unreasonable preconditions" despite its efforts for peace and reunification.
					
					 It is, however, the DPRK which has made every possible effort for the reunification of Korea.
					
					 The south Korean authorities are entirely to blame for the deterioration of the inter-Korean relations.
					
					 They should accept the DPRK's proposals for mending the relations.

articles.title: Secretario general de organizacion politica malaya se reune con delegacion de PTC
articles.content:
Secretario general de organizacion politica malaya se reune con delegacion de PTC
Pyongyang, 29 de noviembre (ACNC) -- El secretario general de la Organizacion Nacional de Malayos Unidos de Malasia, Datuk Seri Tengku Adnan Tengku Mansor, departio el dia 26 con la delegacion del Partido del Trabajo de Corea encabezada por el subjefe de departamento del Comite Central del PTC, Pak Kun Gwang, quien realiza una visita a ese pais para participar en el congreso de la organizacion malaya.
					El secretario general expreso agradecimiento al Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del PTC, por el envio de la delegacion coreana al congreso y dijo que la Organizacion Nacional de Malayos Unidos esta contenta de que todo marche bien en la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea bajo la direccion del PTC.
					
					Menciono que el PTC y el pueblo coreano se esfuerzan mucho por la construccion economica y el mejoramiento de la vida del pueblo.
					
					Continuo que desarrollar positivamente las relaciones con el PTC es la posicion invariable de su organizacion politica.
					
					Acto seguido, quedo rubricada una nota de entendimiento sobre la cooperacion e intercambio entre ambos partidos.

articles.title: Nombrado embajador coreano en Etiopia
articles.content:
Nombrado embajador coreano en Etiopia
Pyongyang, 29 de noviembre (ACNC) -- Segun un decreto correspondiente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Chol Ho fue designado como nuevo embajador extraordinario y plenipotenciario de la RPDC a acreditarse en la Republica Federal Democratica de Etiopia.

articles.title: Tienen lugar mitines de militares y civiles en Nampho y Rason
articles.content:
Tienen lugar mitines de militares y civiles en Nampho y Rason
Pyongyang, 29 de noviembre (ACNC) -- Tuvieron lugar el dia 29 en las ciudades de Nampho y Rason los mitines de militares y civiles para expresar apoyo a la declaracion del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y frustrar el complot de Estados Unidos y sus fuerzas seguidoras.
					Estuvieron presentes los funcionarios de los organismos locales del Partido, el Poder y la economia y entidades de masas, los oficiales y soldados del Ejercito Popular de Corea y el Ejercito de Seguridad Interior del Pueblo de Corea, los trabajadores, jovenes y estudiantes.
					
					Ante todo, se dio lectura a la declaracion del CDN de la RPDC y hubo discursos de los representantes de oficiales y soldados del EPC, obreros, trabajadores agricolas, jovenes y estudiantes.
					
					Los oradores senalaron que la "resolucion de DDHH" anti-RPDC de EE.UU. y sus fuerzas satelites es el producto de la falsificacion politica penetrada por absurdo sofisma de los atemorizados ante el espiritu heroico de Corea que avanza con vigor hacia adelante.
					
					Es ridiculo que EE.UU., infierno de DDHH hable del problema de "DDHH" de alguien, subrayaron y destacaron que el ejercito y el pueblo de Corea no estaran con brazos cruzados el hecho de que EE.UU. y sus fuerzas satelites ofendan verdaderos derechos humanos y violan la soberania y el poder estatal de la RPDC y les daran implacable castigo.
					
					Al termino de mitines hubo manifestaciones de masas.
